pullsbody:
The code uses ARM_NEON_2_x86_SSE converter. I used it to convert the neon code to support SSSE3 and SSE 4.2. The gains in a SSE 4.2 Intel(R) Celeron(R) CPU 847 @ 1.10GHz are impressive. For a 11s audio:

Without optimization:
time lpcnet_demo -decode speech_orig-16k.lpc-2 speech_orig-16k-reconstructed.raw  
real    0m32.968s
user    0m32.954s
sys     0m0.013s

With optimization:
time ./lpcnet_demo -decode speech_orig-16k.lpc-2 speech_orig-16k-reconstructed.raw
real    0m9.855s
user    0m9.850s
sys     0m0.009s
pull_commit_message: Optimized support support for SSSE3 and SSE 4.2.

pulltitle: Pre-computed condition vector and gruB non-recurrent weights
pullsbody:
I added precomputation of 128dim condition vector with GRUB non-recurrent weights and speed up 5%.

Test audio : 10 utterences

Methods | time/s|
--------- | --------|
master | 8.24 |
pre_GRUB(this) | 7.83 |
ratio | 0.95 |
pull_commit_message: Pre-computed condition vector and gruB non-recurrent weights

Fixes #41


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #41.

_(Message COC002)_

pullsbody:
Hi Jean-Marc,

A PR for you consider:

1. Added getopt cmd line option handling to dump_data
2. Added steaming via stdin/stdout if '-' used as file names:
   ```./dump_data --test ~/Downloads/speech_orig_16k.s16 - | ./test_lpcnet - - | aplay -f S16_LE -r 16000```
3. Cleaned up unhandled return warnings

Cheers,
David
pull_commit_message: (i) added getopt cmd line option handling to dump_data (ii) added streaming via stdin/stdout if '-' used as file names (iii) cleaned up unhandled return warnings
